title: Add a specific Principal as application administrator

requirements.text: Grant administrator permissions to the Principal ID `hrxqg-aty7r-ze5hr-pldpb-ool7h-fy2rn-npy5t-lvtmr-lccbl-bdj53-pae` so that this identity is recognized by backend authorization as an application administrator (i.e., passes all `#admin` permission checks and returns `true` from `isCallerAdmin()`).

quotes: add principal ID: hrxqg-aty7r-ze5hr-pldpb-ool7h-fy2rn-npy5t-lvtmr-lccbl-bdj53-pae as application administrator

acceptanceCriteria: When calling backend admin-gated methods (e.g., resident create/update/discharge/archive/delete) while authenticated as `hrxqg-aty7r-ze5hr-pldpb-ool7h-fy2rn-npy5t-lvtmr-lccbl-bdj53-pae`, the backend does not trap with an unauthorized error.
The frontend `useIsCallerAdmin` query returns `true` for the Principal `hrxqg-aty7r-ze5hr-pldpb-ool7h-fy2rn-npy5t-lvtmr-lccbl-bdj53-pae`.
The admin grant remains effective after a canister upgrade (if the authorization state is persisted across upgrades).

constraints: Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister with logic in backend/main.mo.

If adding this admin requires modifying persisted/stable authorization state, implement it via the platform's conditional migration policy using backend/migration.mo; do not reset or wipe existing state.
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication providers or any third-party auth; keep Internet Identity as-is.
Do not change unrelated registration/token behavior beyond what is necessary to grant admin to the specified Principal.
